"love this musical albeit a bit risqu?? it was laugh out loud funny. It is not for everyone though and I did advise a friend that she may not like it. By the makers of South Park it is a hysterical critique of the missionary's journey to Uganda to civilise the natives with the Good News of the Book of  but it could be any radical Christian group that often head to third world countries to bring their ""truth"". It is intellectually stimulating and funny send up of this scenario. Acted out well by the entire cast who keep you entertained and laughing throughout the production. Great night in NYC. I took my teenager and she love it but it is definitely for mature audiences and I would definitely research it before jumping in if you are offended easily."			The Book of 	Hysterical	jennifer L	--

This was the fastest  / hours I have ever experienced. The acting was wonderful...the music was wonderful...the costumes were wonderful (be sure to pay close attention to the details in the costumes...hilarious...broom brist and old Christmas tree toppers!). If you see one Broadway show this year

"I had read the book (The Day the World Came to Town) upon which this show was based so I knew what to expect. I had no idea how they would make a Broadway show out of it but they did and they did it expertly. I also knew to bring tissues

This play touch my heart in so many ways. I once lived in Gander and know many of the characters being portrayed. I could feel the hype as  planes were sent to this town doubling the population. Both the townsfolk and passengers were so affected by such a tragedy that brought out the humanness throughout the production. It was a class performance with hospitality
"As a Canadian
This excellent production tells the story of tiny Gander

What a great show! A must see! I especially liked how the very emotional topic of / was handled. The minute that I began to feel the tears of memories of that terrible day a very funny line was said and the comedy prevented me from feeeling so bad. This was repeated over and over..ma this an upbeat show about a horrible time in our history. The actors and actresses performed many different ro
I just saw this show with my two best friends and I was left speechs and in tears. This is a show that if everyone in the world would see it
"The show was wonderful. It reminded us of September th but in a ""hope for humanity"" type of way. The actors were extremely talented

I had never been to a Broadway show. I was hoping to get rush tickets the morning of the matinee which are cheaper but no luck. I paid full price.??  I wasn't thrilled to spend that much for a  minute show but I was blown away with the performance. There was no intermission which is good as the story kept flowing. The staging was phenomenal. Minimal props and a rotating center that turned and changed configuration allowing several different settings to be imagined. The musicians are right up on stage but you hardly notice as they are discreetly hidden behind the trees. I'm Canadian so I was watching for iconic Canadian and Newfoundland items and authenticity - they were quite evident.  The performers blew me away - they slipped in and out of various accents and clothing pieces as they portrayed several characters each. I cried several times as this side story of how  affected others out of the immediate vicinity but we're still tied to it in many ways played out.			Come From Away	So worth seeing; funny and poinant - bring tissues	Darkwing	--
This is my new fave! I laughed
coming from someone who normally doesn't like musicals this musical play was an unexpected win. The acting was superb
GO GO GO! this is an amazing and touching show that I will never forget. Had me choked up for  mins after the show			Come From Away	amazing show	nkearns	--

I had the chance to see this amazing show recently while in NYC. I was so impressed with the powerful and positive energy from the talented cast and the amazing set design. Everything is pared down to focus on the storyline which evokes both laughter and tears and which highlights the genuine humanity and generosity of the residents of small towns like Gander. I was so proud to be an Atlantic Canadian in the crowd
This is one of the very best shows you will ever see. The cast and set are superb. And the music is great. It is a moving and emotional performance
My wife was loo forward to this play but I had no expectations. I was blown away. By the story
Best musical I have seen in a long time!!  great minutes! There is no intermission during this Broadway show
I love this show. Everything about it - music
I cried through this show
"Difficult to expand on the great reviews
I knew a little bit about the story
"We make a yearly trip to New York to see a show and

Saw Come From Away this past Saturday night and thought it was absolutely fantastic!! My husband and I both love it. I went in not expecting much and I came out feeling as though I saw such a great Broadway show. It was fun
"Wow. Just Wow. Go see this show. You will not be disappointed. Doesn't matter if you are from the US

" by far is one of the top musicals on Broadway as well as touring the country. I've seen it several times and have never been disappointed. The actress playing Elphaba is phenomenal as well as the actress playing Glinda. The musical is based on Gregory MaGuire's book on the untold stories of the witches of Oz and not the one as we know it by Frank Baum. Therefore there are plot twists and additions to make the story interesting. The musical numbers soar along with the signature piece ""Defying Gravity"". It is currently playing at the Gershwin theater which is an attraction in its on right. Inside this theater are large plaques of yearly lists of the best actors and actresses from Broadway. It is always interesting to see who made the list for the current year. You can also dress up on the mezzanine level and have your photo taken as a character and by digital imagery placed right in the middle of the Emerald City. Please note that there are scary sequences with the dragon on the proscenium that may frighten young children. The winged monkeys have and always will be my favorite part of the show. Strong performances are given by the actors playing Fiyero and Boq as well as the wizard himself. I don't want to spoil to show but this is indeed a show not to be missed!!"				Still going strong after  years!	Arlene M	--

"This is an interesting experience and I would recommend doing it at least once. It's an ""immersive play"" set in a -story building where actors run around various rooms in the building (supposed to be McKittrick Hotel) and pantomime and dance various scenes (actors don't talk). All spectators follow the actors from room to room (different actors take different routes through the building) and try to make sense of what's going on. All spectators wear white masks (you get to keep them) and are not supposed to speak to each other or to the actors.  The performance takes  hours (e.g. pm-pm). There are three -hour ""loops"" in each -hour performance when actors do the same thing. Because there are many actors and many rooms in the building and because action happens in different rooms (most of the time)

I had mixed feelings about seeing this show as I wasn't really a fan of Carol  growing up. WHAT A SURPRISE!!! It was one of the better shows I've seen! It was such a great story and I now have a much greater appreciation of Carol  and her songs. My husband and I enjoyed it so much that we are going back to see it again with my sister and her husband. The theatre (Songheim) is on the small side so ANYWHERE that you sit is a good view of the stage. I love all the theatres in New York. Of course you are right in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District so there are tons of restaurants to choose from....and its not a far walk to Grand Central Station if you are ta the train. "For any who have seen  Miserab in the past you are in for a thrill of a lifetime! Up until now I never thought I could have seen a better actor portray the lead than Colm Wilikinson. Ramin Karimloo has shown me that he can play Jean Val Jean to that level. His signature solo ""Bring him home"" brought a standing ovation from the audience. His nemesis Javert is equally portrayed as mean and cruel by the excellent talents of Will Swenson. The famous ""turntable"" used in the original performances has been removed and replaced by the artwork of Victor Hugo who wrote the novel as well as with computer imagery. Believe me you'll never miss it because every detail is still there. The set extends on the sides partially into the audience to give you more of a ""feel"" of the drama. Please note however
